page.title: 09TONBRIDGE SCHOOL CHAPEL
page.content: The original Chapel of St.Augustine was founded in 1859.In 1900,the found- ation stone for an enlarged Chapel was laid by the Master of the Skinners' Company.This new Chapel,with a new organ,was built by Rev.C.C.Tancock and was completed in 1909 at a cost of Â£17,827.The Reredos is in memory of C. Lowry (Headmaster 1907-22) and Lucas and David (Assistant Masters).The win- dows and panels on the North Side are in memory of Old Tonbridgians who died in the South African War.There are al- so memorial windows on the South Side. The stained glass windows portray Saints Andrew,Patrick,Margaret,Denis, George and Christopher.The Chapel is primarily used by the school,but also by the Tonbridge Philharmonic Orches- tra and Choir,who rehearse and per- form classical music concerts there.
